benchmark_details.name: RoomSpace (A Real-World Simulation Benchmark for Qualitative Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a novel benchmark for assessing qualitative spatial reasoning (QSR) in language models, grounded in realistic 3D simulation data, offering a series of diverse room layouts with various objects and their spatial relationships.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate language models' capabilities in qualitative spatial reasoning using realistic scenarios derived from 3D simulations.

data.source: 3D simulation data utilizing the ProcTHOR framework.
data.format: Textual narratives with associated spatial relationship data.
data.annotation: Automated generation based on spatial relationship constraints.

methodology.calculation: Metrics include assessing the consistency of language models' answers within given spatial constraints.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is evaluated based on the ability to predict plausible spatial relations given multiple valid interpretations.
methodology.validation: Evaluated various LLMs, including GPT-4, across different configurations of spatial reasoning tasks.
